alert.note: Alert for Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 12:07PM EST until January 30 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Richland and Calhoun Counties. North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg affecting Orangeburg County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in South Carolina... Stevens Creek Near Modoc affecting Edgefield and McCormick Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Some minor flooding occurs along the boardwalk at Edisto Gardens. Downstream from the Highway 301 bridge, some roads off Chiquita street near the river begin to flood. At 10.0 feet, Farmland and lowlands along Highway 301 near Orangeburg become flooded at stages above 10 ft. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 8.1 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 115 PM EST.
